Shit... Those small phone keyboards...
Stuff comes from my head pretty fast. I wonder why my blog is not popular.
@yilmazerkan@zv: thanks, I thought some OTHER people will comment =D

I know most of my ideas are crappy, but that only means more debates, does it not?? But the only comments I usually get are from Erkan (thank you man! Would be pretty empty without you!), and I was thinking, why?
@yilmazerkan@zv: typos, and I press "Enter" when I don't want it sometimes.

@yilmazerkan@zv: You make a lot of typos and mistakes in chats and mails (and in some cases even in blog), so get over it: everyone makes mistakes. It would take me MUCH more time to check words I'm not sure about in translator.
Even if I would write in Russian I'm not sure I would make less mistakes. Russian is harder than English and having it as a native tongue does not mean "know it"

And I have started to comment other's blogs. I never thought about it as something important before, but a cuple days ago when all my friends got bored of me again, I've decided to read blogs and write some comments. Proved much better than asking bored friends why they hate me so much =D
@flyman@zid: It's not OK to write in languages that people don't understand. But yes, I'm Russian. Can we please continue in English? You can write me an e-mail if you wanna chat in Russian.

However I prefer English ever since I've heared that writing in non-native tongue helps to construct thoughts more properly. Problem is that I write in English more often than I write in Russian, so I was thinking of learning German, just to have that uncomfortable non-native tongue feeling.

@yilmazerkan@zv: I start to think that color differentiation for ZeroVerse is not a bad idea. That bright blue may be uncomfortable for an eye, but when I see it, I'm sure where I am (not in ZMail). Good job =D

@flyman@zid: You do. You should have written "So I think I am making typos". 1) You forgot to add "am"; 2) As my teacher said, English punctuation is much simplier from Russian, so when you are not sure should you add a comma or not, DON'T add it! =D
@flyman@zid: The same with German and me. However I've learned a couple of songs =D
*simplier than
DAMN IT, Erkan! WHAT HAVE YOU DONE?!!
I can't even make a typo now!((
Ah.. not to worry, I'm so lazy that I'll revert to making typos sooner or later =))))
@yilmazerkan@zv: means that we are? cool!)
/me wants to eat. AFK. Have a nice day ppl =D
@flyman@zid: what DOES "afk" mean (without s)
@flyman@zid: as far as I understand, you can say "And what "afk" means
@flyman@zid: and "what is the meaning of AFK?" would be correct for sure
also shorter "what is AFK?"
And if you are not sure how to type, you can just write "AFK??" and people will understand you just fine
however "what is "afk" means" does hurt some people's feelings =D (like Erkan)
@flyman@zid: I don't need a keyboard to be annoying! I write from my tablet! ;D
ha-ha-heh)) look, I make people learn =D
literally, I MAKE them do it >=D

yup. But windows is still a default OS on PC's in many countries..

PCs are still have great importance for people. Yes it's great that modems run on Linux, not on some MS crap (or NSA would really have all our asses), but if you don't want a console, you'll mos definitely choose Windows as a gaming PC OS.
The same for offices - database applications (check), Office packs (check), IDE (not so much of a check already) - all those things are done better by MS.
And while they control both DB apps and Office, it's a check-mate
I like Libre Office much, but come on... As soon as you start to do anything serious, MS Office is your choice.
And don't even start talking about Libre Office Base. It suck...

Android? I think of it as of a very corrupted linux OS, mostly the same shit as Windows, but with less comfortable office apps and up until this day it is being treated as some game-tablets' and phones' OS. However I do use my tablet for writing down lectures and stuff, it's still almost impossible to do serious stuff there. Not even speaking about databases...
By corrupted, I don't mean bugs, bad code, security holes being the only kind of security.. I mean smth like that http://www.look.com.ua/download.php?file=201209/1600x900/look.com.ua-41593.jpg
corrupted idea of a free, secure and customisable OS GNU/Linux like what desktop linux distributions are.
Android is like a lame kid of Linux and Google.
can anyone recomend a spellchecker? Something with GNU license and preferably online... (Thanks to Erkan, I can't post my posts as usually, and have to run a spellchecker!..)
I've found it. https://languagetool.org/
What's GNU LGPL? Why would they not use GPL? What's the difference?
